title: Brush Twice Daily
description: Brush your teeth for two minutes, twice a day, using a fluoride toothpaste to prevent cavities.

title: Floss Every Day
description: Flossing removes plaque and bacteria from between teeth where a toothbrush can't reach.

title: Limit Sugary Foods
description: Sugar converts to acid in the mouth, which can erode enamel. Limit sweets and acidic drinks.

title: Visit Dentist Regularly
description: Schedule checkups every 6 months to catch issues early and get professional cleaning.

title: Use Mouthwash
description: Therapeutic mouthwash can reduce plaque, gingivitis, and bad breath.

title: Drink More Water
description: Water washes away food residue and keeps your mouth hydrated, neutralizing acids.

title: Don't Smoke
description: Smoking increases the risk of gum disease and oral cancer. Quitting improves oral health significantly.

title: Replace Your Toothbrush
description: Change your toothbrush every 3-4 months or sooner if the bristles are frayed.
